properties.areaDesc: Warren, NJ; Sussex, NJ; Monroe, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 8:30AM EST until January 8 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey...
North central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey...
Northern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania...

* Until 915 AM EST.

* At 830 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Pecks Pond to Mount Pocono, moving east at 45
mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes the following highways...
Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 296 and 297.
Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 5.

Locations impacted include...
Port Jervis, Newton, Montague, Mount Pocono, Franklin, Hamburg,
Ogdensburg, Sussex, Milford, Branchville, High Point, Henryville,
Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Millbrook, Skytop, Vernon Valley,
Mountainhome, Alpine Mountain and Pellettown.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 9:15 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
